security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution, network access, or filesystem modifications. Generates test case text and outputs Excel files based on structured templates.

content.value_statement: Writing test cases from requirement documents takes significant time and often misses edge cases. This skill analyzes requirements in any format (text, images, PDF, DOCX) and automatically generates comprehensive, standardized test cases following 15-fieldè§„èŒƒ with Excel export.
actual_capabilities: Parses requirements from text, images, PDF, and DOCX formats
Generates structured test cases following 15-field specification
Covers normal flow, boundary values,å¼‚å¸¸ scenarios, and security testing
Exports formatted Excel files with proper styling
Calculates test case statistics and provides summary reports
Identifies missing information and asks clarifying questions
limitations: Does not execute test cases or interact with test systems
Cannot access external APIs or databases for test data
Output is limited to Excel format (other formats require manual conversion)
Relies on quality of input requirements for test case completeness

use_cases.title: Accelerate test case authoring
use_cases.description: Transform requirement documents into comprehensive test cases in minutes instead of hours

use_cases.title: Validate requirement completeness
use_cases.description: Generate test cases to identify gaps in requirements before development begins

use_cases.title: Understand edge cases early
use_cases.description: Review generated test cases to anticipate and handle edge scenarios during implementation

best_practices: Provide complete requirement details including business rules, error messages, and validation constraints
Specify the desired test case count or focus areas when submitting large requirements
Review and validate generated test cases against actual system behavior
Use the clarification questions feature when requirements are incomplete
anti_patterns: Submitting vague or incomplete requirements and expecting complete test coverage
Relying solely on AI-generated test cases without human review
Ignoring the clarification questions when important details are missing
Using generated test cases as direct test scripts without adaptation

faq.question: What formats does the skill accept for requirements?
faq.answer: Accepts plain text, Markdown, images (flowcharts, UI designs), PDF documents, and DOCX files.

faq.question: How many test cases are typically generated?
faq.answer: Automatically generates 10-50 test cases based on requirement complexity, ensuring comprehensive coverage.

faq.question: Can I export to formats other than Excel?
faq.answer: Default output is Excel. For other formats like CSV or Markdown, request conversion after generation.

faq.question: Is my requirement data stored or shared?
faq.answer: No data is stored. All processing occurs within the Claude session and files are downloaded locally.

faq.question: Why are clarification questions sometimes asked?
faq.answer: The skill identifies missing information critical for executable test cases and asks up to 5 clarifying questions.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual test case writing?
faq.answer: Reduces hours of work to minutes while ensuring standardized output follows industry best practices.
